Rice.description: Rice is widely cultivated in regions with sufficient rainfall and warm temperatures.

Maize.description: Maize is a versatile crop grown across different regions and seasons.

Cotton.description: Cotton is commonly grown during the monsoon season and thrives in warm regions.

Groundnut.description: Groundnut grows well in light soils and is commonly cultivated in western and southern India.

Millets.description: Millets are hardy crops suitable for low rainfall regions.

Sunflower.description: Sunflower adapts well to a variety of soils and is grown for edible oil.

Chickpea.description: Chickpea is a winter pulse crop grown widely in northern and central India.

Black Gram.description: Black gram is a fast-growing pulse crop suited to warm conditions.

Wheat.description: Wheat is a major winter crop grown in cooler conditions.

Mustard.description: Mustard is widely grown as an oilseed crop during the winter season.

Vegetables.description: Vegetable cultivation includes multiple short-duration crops grown across seasons.

Jute.description: Jute is a fiber crop grown mainly in eastern India under humid conditions.

Pulses.description: Pulses include lentils and beans that improve soil fertility.

Peas.description: Peas are cool-season crops grown mainly in winter.

Pumpkin.description: Pumpkin is suitable for warm seasons and grows well in diverse soils.

Cucumber.description: Cucumber is a fast-growing summer vegetable requiring warm temperatures.

Muskmelon.description: Muskmelon is a summer fruit crop grown in warm regions.

Bajra.description: Bajra is a drought-resistant crop suitable for arid regions.

Barley.description: Barley is grown in cooler regions and requires less water than wheat.

Paddy.description: Paddy refers to rice grown in flooded field conditions.

Soybean.description: Soybean is widely grown for oil and protein content.

Gram.description: Gram is a commonly grown winter pulse crop.

Jowar.description: Jowar is a drought-tolerant cereal crop.

Tomato.description: Tomato is widely cultivated as a vegetable crop across seasons.

Ragi.description: Ragi is a nutritious millet grown in dry regions.

Coconut.description: Coconut is a perennial crop grown in coastal and tropical regions.

Pepper.description: Pepper is a spice crop grown in tropical regions.

Banana.description: Banana is a widely grown fruit crop in tropical climates.

Sugarcane.description: Sugarcane is a major cash crop grown in irrigated regions.

Potato.description: Potato is a cool-season vegetable crop.

Brinjal.description: Brinjal is a common vegetable grown in warm conditions.

Watermelon.description: Watermelon is a summer fruit crop grown in warm regions.

Lentil.description: Lentil is a winter pulse crop commonly grown in northern and eastern India, valued for its protein content.
